alert.note: Alert for Essex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:18PM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts...Rhode Island... Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. Blackstone River At Northbridge affecting Worcester County. Sudbury River At Saxonville affecting Middlesex County. Shawsheen River At Andover affecting Essex County. Blackstone River At Woonsocket affecting Worcester and Providence Counties. Charles River At Dover affecting Middlesex and Norfolk Counties. Neponset River At Norwood affecting Norfolk and Suffolk Counties. Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Kent and Providence Counties. Taunton River Near Bridgewater affecting Bristol and Plymouth Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Assabet River At Maynard affecting Middlesex and Worcester Counties. Shawsheen River Near Wilmington affecting Middlesex and Essex Counties. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Assabet River...including Maynard...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Shawsheen River...including Wilmington, Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Blackstone River...including Northbridge, Woonsocket... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Charles River...including Dover...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Neponset River...including Norwood...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Pawtuxet River...including Scituate Reservoir, Cranston... Major flooding is forecast. For the Taunton River...including Bridgewater...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Shawsheen River at Andover. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 31.0 feet, Floodwaters inundate the lowest lying parking lots along Route 114 adjacent to the Shawsheen River. This includes drainage fronting the North Andover Mall along Route 114. Floodwaters encroach on Route 114 hotel building in Lawrence, adjacent to the river. Floodwaters encroach on lowest lying properties along Glenwood Street in North Andover. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 28.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 29 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 28.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to 30.3 feet early Friday afternoon. It will fall to 30.0 feet early Saturday morning then rise again. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.6 feet on 04/01/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 700 AM EST.
